column1: Official Project Launch day:  Friday 6th August 2021
1 This dashboard is divided into multiple panels. All the panels are collapsed to increase the performance when dashboard loads.
2 To Expand each panel, please look for an "Left" arrow next to "X" button and click on it.
Please feel free to make changes to the dashboard, you can save your changes as your own copy. This dashboard will not be affected.
To save your own copy follow these steps
Click on Project on the top
It will be saved in Workspace section under you profile. you can share your save dashboard too. Just click on share button above.
# Read Me to understand more about the Metrics used for analytics
Page Views:  Number of time page was loaded.
Visits: A visit is defined as a sequence of consecutive page views without a 30-minute break, or continuous activity for 12 hours.

Unique visitor: A unique visitor refers to a visitor who visits a site for the first time within a 2 years period. If visitor clears browser cookies or does not allow cookies, unique visitor count will be incremented every time when page is visited.

Occurrences: The number of times a specific value is captured, plus the number of page views for which the given value persisted. In other words, Occurrences are sum of page views and page events. Occurrences are available in Analysis Workspace and in Ad Hoc Analysis.
Bounces: If a visit consists of exactly one hit (ex: coming to web page and leaving without any further action) , the hit is considered a bounce.

Entries: the number of times a given dimension item is captured as the first value in a visit. This metric is helpful when you want to understand more about the first impressions visitors have on your site. Seeing the first values of a dimension can help you understand and optimize the experience a new visitor gets

Bounce Rate (Bounces/Entries): the ratio of visits that contained exactly one hit compared to the number of visits on that page. This metric is calculated using the formula Bounces divided by Entries.
Exits: The 'Exits' metric shows the number of times a given dimension item is captured as the last value in a visit.
Exit Rate: The percentage of traffic to a page for whom that was the last page or piece of content. This metric is calculate using formula Exits divided by Visits
